Risk_Information:

Population Risk for HSR is 5-8 % of exposed patients
HSR risk for HLA-B*57:01 - approximately 50%

Heterozygotes:

FDA_Relevant_Labeling_Sections_1: Dosage and Administration, Warnings and Precautions, Drug Interactions, Clinical Pharmacology
Dosage and Administration, Warnings and Precautions, Drug Interactions, Adverse Reactions, Clinical Pharmacology
Risk_Information:
Normal Metabolizer: ~ 86-97% of population

Intermediate Metabolizer: ~ 3-14% of population
~30-60% will experience myelosuppression at conventional dosing

Poor Metabolizer: ~ 1% of population
~100% will experience life threatening myelosuppression at conventional dosing

Favorable Response:
90% chance of SVR after 24-48 weeks
80-90% of patients are eligible for shortened treatment (medication dependent)

Unfavorable Response:
60% chance of SVR after 24-48 weeks
50% of patients are eligible for shortened treatment (medication dependent)

FDA_Relevant_Labeling_Sections_1: Contraindications, Warnings and Precautions, Patient Information
Risk_Information:
Normal Metabolizers:  95-97 % of patients
~ 10-40% are at risk for severe toxicity

Intermediate Metabolizers: 3-5% of patients
Poor Metabolizers: 0.2 % of patients

PPV: ~50-62%  NPV: ~90%
50-62% of patients with reduced function variants in DPYD will have severe reactions at conventional doses

Inducers: CYP2B6, CYP2C9, CYP2C19, CYP3A4, CYP3A5, & CYP3A7
Risk_Information:
HLA-B*15:02
Han Chinese: 
HLA-B*15:02 carrier rate is 15.3-19.8% in population
HLA-B*15:02 carrier rate is 63% in all SJS/TEN cases

Patient is 38.6 times more likely to develop SJS/TEN (OR = 38.65) than non-carrier population

HLA-A*31:01
Risk for HSS or MPE:  patient is 26.3 times and 8.57 times more likely to experience HSS or MPE (respectively) than non-carriers

Risk_Information:
GRIK4:
Favorable Response: Reduces risk of non-response to citalopram by 11% 

Unfavorable Response: 11% less likely to respond to citalopram than C-allele carriers
